questions.question_text: What impact does disabling detections on a host have on an API?

choices.C: DetectionSummaryEvent stops sending to the Streaming API for that host
choices.B: Endpoints cannot have their detections disabled individually
choices.D: Endpoints with detections disabled will not alert on anything for 24 hours (by default) or longer if that setting is changed
choices.A: Endpoints with detections disabled will not alert on anything until detections are enabled again

questions.question_text: Even though you are a Falcon Administrator, you discover you are unable to use the "Connect to Host" feature to gather additional information which is only available on the host. Which role do you need added to your user account to have this capability?
Under which scenario can Sensor Tags be assigned?

choices.C: While updating a sensor in the Falcon console
choices.B: While managing hosts in the Falcon console

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct,

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
Check in documentation, there are two kind of tags, the Falcon Grouping Tags that can be managed in falcon console or API and the Sensor Grouping Tags that are configured as parameter in cli, that kind of tags can be diferentiated because it appears with the prefix SensorGroupingTags followed with the name of the tag.
If you want to modify a sensor tag is necessary change a registry key value and reboot the device or waiting until the sensor is upgraded.
Definitely the D is the right answer.
Correct Answer is D - Changes after installation require a registry edit and a host reboot; otherwise, the changes take effect when the sensor is next upgraded. (From documentation)
Tricky question - both B and D could be the right answers.

comments.content: Sensor tags are only configured at installation, the falcon groupoing tags are configured in the console. after the installation you can configure the sensor but you'll need to reboot the host

The reporting interval is predefined and cannot be changed. You can only enable/disable the custom alert feature and add/remove recipient email client for the alert/detection.

Selected Answer: B
In the console all the custom alerts have a Monitoring Frecuency, and none can be set as real time, so the D option is not possible and the only feasible option is B.

Selected Answer: D
two reasons: security staff need to see what’s going on in their environment in real-time

questions.question_text: With Custom Alerts, it is possible to __________.

choices.B: receive an alert in an email
choices.D: be alerted to activity in real-time
choices.A: schedule the alert to run at any interval
